name: CheMin
description: The CheMin database is a living repository of CheMin and related MSL data integrated with tools and procedures for visualization and analysis.

fields.name: Analysis ID
fields.description: The unique identifier of the analysis

fields.name: Type of analysis
fields.description: The type of analysis: Calibration, Drill, or Scoop

fields.name: Sol(s) of Analysis
fields.description: The sol, or range of sols, during which the sample was analyzed

fields.name: CheMin cell
fields.description: The cell used to analyze the sample

fields.name: Narrative
fields.description: The narrative that describes the events of the analysis

fields.name: Mars Area Location
fields.description: Location where the sample was collected

fields.name: Site position
fields.description: The site position tag of the analysis

fields.name: Distance to Bradbury (m)
fields.description: The distance, in meters, from the Bradbury Landing site

fields.name: AMCSD Phase List
fields.description: List of AMCSD Phases used in the analysis of this sample.

related_databases.name: Mineral Abundances
related_databases.description:
This table contains mineral abundances and
 analytical errors derived from diffraction-all K-alpha diffraction data

fields.name: AMCSD ID
fields.description: American Mineralogist Structural Database identification number

fields.name: Journal
fields.description: The name of the journal in which this article was published.

fields.name: Volume
fields.description: The volume number of the journal the article was published in.

fields.name: Year
fields.description: What year the article was published.

fields.name: Pages
fields.description: The pages the article takes up in the journal.

fields.name: Month
fields.description: What month the article was published.

fields.name: Publisher Location
fields.description: The location of the publisher of the book.

fields.name: Annotation
fields.description: Annotation about the book or article

fields.name: File
fields.description: A file containing a scan of the physical reference.
